quest.name: Those Who Serve
journal: Maurilette wishes to teach Charlemend and Maelie the particulars of patient rehabilitation.

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: If you are ready, I shall explain how to assist our patients in their rehabilitation.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: I'm ready, Maurilette!

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: (-???-)There you are, Uncle!

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: R-Ronantain! What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: I'm here to bring you back to your senses! Since returning from abroad, you have turned your back on your highborn peers, choosing instead to consort with lowborn rabble!

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: And as if that weren't unseemly enough, it transpires that you are working at an infirmary used by commoners! Your actions threaten to erode the standing that we nobles have had for generations!

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: You've taught me everything I know, Uncle. You've taught me to follow in your footsteps, and I wanted naught more than to do you proud.

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: But now I scarcely recognize you! Whatever has happened to the man I so respected? Wherever he has gone, I want him back!

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: ...My apologies for the commotion. Please, continue.

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: Are you certain, Charlemend? Should you not attend to your nephew first?

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Nay, this is a family matter, and I will not have it disrupt our work. I shall have words with my nephew afterwards.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: But he looked so sad and lonely... I'm goin' after him!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Come with me, Forename!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: The equipment you made is goin' to make our patients better! Isn't that great?

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: It is a starkly different world in which the nobles live. One which brings its own unique challenges.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: There he is, Forename! Ronantain!

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: Hmph, that's Lord Ronantain to you!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Oh, hmph yourself! Don't you know there's no more highborn and lowborn? We're all just Ishgardians now. Your uncle himself said so!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: But never mind that now. You have to make up with him, you know. Your uncle. You do like him, don't you?

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: Th-That's none of your business!

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: But...you have the right of it. Since my father died in the war, my uncle has treated me as his own son. There is no one I admire more. But of late, I struggle to understand him...

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Might be as you don't understand him, but your uncle's a good man. And you have to cherish the family you've got. So come on, let's go back to the infirmary.

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: Bah, fine! I'll return, but do not think for a moment that it is because you said so!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Family should get along. Isn't that right?

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: You found Ronantain? That is well.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename, Maelie. 'Twas not my wish to embroil you in family affairs.

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: Not only do you keep the company of commoners; you would even bow to them!? We are of the noble blood of the knights twelve! Surely you've not forgotten this!

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Listen well, my dear boy. While it is important to uphold tradition and honor our ancestors, I have come to see that it is wrong to look down upon others simply on account of their birth.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Besides, as you too should know, it has since been revealed that all Ishgardians are descended from the knights twelve. This makes all of us equal according to our very own traditions.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: After centuries upon centuries of the privileged standing we nobles have enjoyed, it is no easy thing to accept change. But the age where one's birth determines one's worth has ended, and change will come whether we will it or no.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Hereon, 'tis our deeds that shall speak for us. That shall dictate our place in the world.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: To use an analogy─when you are exhausted after combat training, what is it that you desire?

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: ...That would be rest, I suppose. And perhaps some sweets with tea.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: In like manner, at the end of a thousand-year war, the people of Ishgard yearn for the sweetness of stability. But stability will not manifest of its own accord. Nay, hard work is necessary to bring it about.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: So I ask you, in an age such as this, whom would you respect more? A man who sits idly by, waiting for the sweets to appear at his table? Or a man who busies himself in an effort to see everyone served?

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: I...I would respect the latter─the man who would see everyone served.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: As you should, my boy. And I know none who serves more diligently than young Maelie here, who places the needs of the patients above all else.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Learning from her fine example, I too am striving to be a man who serves others.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: In this way do I hope to set my own example for you, my heir.

dialogue.name: RONANTAIN
dialogue.text: You're doing this...for me?

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: This came to me in the course of my analogy, but I understand that the rehabilitation process can be trying upon body and mind both.

dialogue.name: CHARLEMEND
dialogue.text: Might we not likewise treat our patients to sweets and tea? I believe it would serve to lift their spirits as they work towards recovery.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Ooh, what a great idea! We had high tea once at the orphanage, and it was really fun!

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: Hm, a high tea shouldn't tax the patients... Very well, let's do it!

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: Forename─as before, we would be grateful if you could provide us with the items we require.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: You oughta give us a hand too, Ronantain!

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Um, Maurilette? Ronantain doesn't work here, but it's all right if he helps, right?

dialogue.name: MAURILETTE
dialogue.text: Just this once, I believe an exception can be made.
